intro: Draba aizoides proles grassensis, commonly known as the grassland whitlow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers in early spring. It is native to the temperate regions of Europe and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Due to its delicate appearance and early blooming habit, it is a valuable species for ecological studies and habitat conservation.
